reviewText: My favorite nursing tank for around the house and to sleep in. Perfect for when you don't want to put on a nursing bra.

Wearing it now! With 9 years of breastfeeding experience under my belt, I'm basically a nursing tank connoisseur. This holds your tits comfortably. Because they come in actual bra sizes it's easy to know what to buy. The shoulder straps are nice and wide (big knockers require wide straps).  You get less Uni-boob with this model than other brands which is nice when you want to pretend you're not a zombie. The only drawnack is that the tag is a smidge itchy. But maybe after a wash it will soften.

I love this nursing tank! I'm a big girl, and it is one of two tanks that fit well, look good, and is functional of many that I bought. Well worth the cost. The straps are substantive, as compaired to the Motherhood tanks, so I'm not worried this is going to break.

As a 7-time cancer survivor, there are companies here on Amazon that make wonderful head wraps for people on chemotherapy.  This is not one of those items.

reviewText:
I must say that I'm actually really pleased with this dress (I had gotten the one in purple). I tend to be skeptical when buying clothes online, but this fits very well.  The dress looks exactly like the picture, while the belt is comparable. The material is light weight, which is perfect for summer/spring. It does have a lining on the inside however to keep it from being see through - which is awesome. It's great because you could either dress it up or down, depending on the occasion.

As far as sizing goes, I would say that this dress is intended for women no larger than a size Medium. I'm 5'6", 120 lbs - the dress comes up a few inches above my knee. It is a shorter length dress, so I will be wearing spandex shorts underneath just in case (though I do this with all my dresses regardless). If you are any taller than 5'7" or a bigger busted woman (C is probably pushing it), then this particular set-size listing probably wouldn't be a comfortable choice for you.

I've been buying the cheaper clothing from overseas for a while now and if there is one thing you should know, it's that Asian sizing is about three sizes smaller than ours. For example, I know that I'm going to need an XXL or XXXL for any item that doesn't disclose their shipping origin!

I am 5'6", 36D and approx 180 lb.s (Hourglass/Pear) I got the XXL, and oh man. I love, love, love this top. The sleeves are soft and stretchy, but tight enough to not look saggy. I've attached photos for reference. The shirt is contoured, and the darts to the peplum fit perfectly. At first it was nervous putting it on because it only zips down to the peplum, but once I got it on and zipped, it fit like it was made for me. MADE FOR ME. I'm off to buy the while one now. :) Btw, it's sheer. You'll need a tank top or camisole to wear underneath.
summary: Best Clothing Purchase From Overseas to Date!

reviewText: This would be 1 less star if I had paid more for the glasses.  The lens is cheap plastic, but it does what it's suppose to. I'm highly doubtful that the material of the sunglasses is the same as advertised. Titanium frame, seriously? The only metal I see may be the screws. And glass lens, I'm thinking not. But I try to be realistic, and for $15 including Prime 2-day shipping I think they're still a good value. If all you're looking for are some cheap shades then these will do fine. And as far as appearance, the pictures online are an accurate representation. I do like the texture on the ends of the frame as they wrap behind the ears, they feel like they grip well and are unlikely to slip if you're running or active outdoors.

In a nutshell I think they're good looking shades, they fit well, they do the job, and they're worth $15 with Prime shipping.

I purchased this for my eldest daughter along with a bracelet that this ring matches and she absolutely loves both of them. While I don't see any "educational" value...the ring is, however, very well made & sturdy. The stones are set securely....(the blue setting is gorgeous in person!).... and the alloy that the ring is made of is polished to a high shine so that it looks like silver. My daughter has had the ring/bracelet set for about a month now and there hasn't yet been any sign of wear to the ring band, no chipping or fading..however, I wouldn't recommend wearing the ring everyday solely because of the material it's made of or signs of wear will begin to show quickly.  Any jewelry that is "coated" will begin to fade around the band if worn everyday, so to make the "coated silver finish" of this ring last longer my daughter wears it only 2-3 times a week. Seller also shipped the item the same day it was ordered and it arrived about 2 1/2 weeks after the order was placed. This seller also included a very lovely box that the ring arrived in and can be stored or gifted in and the box was well wrapped in bubble wrap to protect it during transit. All in all.....very pleased with both the purchase & the seller and would recommend this item to anyone that is interested (or has a child interested) in Black Butler Anime.

reviewText:
Let's be honest, Your looking to buy this product to do one of the following: give your body a nice shape, try to flatten your tummy, shed a few inches off your waist, or even posture. Hell, Maybe even all of them . I'm here to honestly tell you how your experience will be with this cincher.

**Please remember cinchers are different than corsets. Corsets are made for more serious waist training.

Posture: I have been using this product for about a week and a half and with it on notice a change in my posture. Mostly because with it on it is uncomfortable to really slouch. Uncomfortable, not unbearable. You most likely sit straighter because the bones in it are plastic and you might break them doing some dramatic moves. I've noticed I walk taller and sit straighter with it on.

Sizing: Based on other reviews I'm sure you notice there is a lot of issues when it comes to choosing the correct size due to the inconsistency. I'm going to try my best to make this as simple as possible. I am a 36C/D bra size. When wearing women's T-shirts I am a Medium (Men's Small) and in dresses I am most comfortable in an 8. The reviews told me to order 2 sizes up so I did, buying  an extra-large (XL).

How it Fit: The first time I ever used the cincher I was able to put it on the tightest setting (second row). Ideally you want to first be able to put it on the loosest setting (1st row) then graduate to the second you know it's working and that your waist may be getting smaller. I may have been better off getting a large. I have ordered another cincher and this time a Large. As far as the initial size I bought (XL) it's not too tight even on the second setting . When I say not too tight, I mean that I can breathe in it . I do feel compression and it does flatten me out but I'd rather have a large just for my preference so keep that in mind. I will say that the XL for me starting off on the second setting was probably a good starting point seeing as though I never typically wear cinchers or corsets.

Gym Use: So far I have used this cincher in the gym. It was not uncomfortable even when sitting down and doing floor exercises. It does give compression allowing for proper use and that little extra something to work your abs . In comparison to a typical exercise bandits does not collect a lot of sweat so it's not extra gross when taking it off after a workout.

Body Shaping: Okay, I'm sure this is where many of you jumped down to. Trust me, this was all I was searching for in reviews. So this cincher actually does give the appearance of a flatter tummy and smaller waist under my clothes, but it is NOT a dramatic difference. I bought this to introduce my tummy and waist to the idea of waist training ( if these are your intentions, this product is a good place to start) HOWEVER, if you are seeking a product to begin serious waist training, it is best to begin with a steel boned corset. This cincher easily takes away 1-2 inches of your waist. May be another inch or two more but I would need a smaller size to be sure. Does give a more flattering appearance under your clothes and active wear at the gym ,

Body Results: Like I have stated previously, I have only had the product after a week in a half. So far, I have seen a slight difference. I'm not sure if it's just when I take it off because everything still seems to be sitting in the right place. But I do feel like I'm pinching less when touching poking and my sides. The current results make me optimistic about future results so I will keep using

Flaws: I can see the cincher hooks through my clothes. I would not recommend wearing with skin tight apparel. If you bend the bones they will snap. Since I have a relatively short torso this cincher meets my bra sometimes pushing in my underwire which is sometimes uncomfortable.

Welp, that's pretty much all I have. If you have any additional comments or questions feel free to contact me at genee143@comcast.net .  I am not paid or anything I just know how hard it is to find honest thorough reviews. I am not sure if amazon has a messaging center but if they do you can message me there as well. Happy Cinching!
summary: The HONEST Review Your Looking For

reviewText: It was not worth what I paid for it . It was very misleading under the description ....

I got my older daughter's prom dress from Gorgeous Bridal and it fit perfectly. The color was different then pictured (it was a pale yellow and they pictured a bright yellow) but I actually liked it better so when it came time to order my younger daughter's prom dress I had no qualms about ordering from Gorgeous Bridal again. I think my mistake was in not communicating as effectively. With my oldest daughter I was very nervous about it and asked a ton of questions and made it very clear what I wanted. I remember telling them that my daughter hated wearing heels and I wanted it to come to the top of her shoes instead of all the way to the floor.. I didn't do that this time so when the dress came it was way too big! It came with a hoop skirt. With the hoop skirt and the highest heels my daughter owns it dragged on the floor. The problem was that my daughter didn't want to wear the hoop skirt or very high heels and she didn't want it to drag on the floor at all so it was about 8-10 inches too long.. It was also too loose on the back. Gorgeous Bridal was willing to alter it and pay for shipping but with the time constraint and the initial cost of shipping it back to China ($65)  I was worried that it wouldn't get back in time. They did a partial refund so that I could get it altered.

To be clear. The dress is absolutely gorgeous. The material is a really good quality and the workmanship is superb. It comes with a tulle slip already sewn in so it pouffs out quite a bit without having to add a hoop skirt. My mistake was in not communicating enough. I sent in my daughter's measurement but I didn't specify how I wanted it to fit. The customer service is really good and they are quick to get back with you, but there is a bit of a language barrier so it's better to spell out exactly how you want it rather then to simply assume they know what you want. I'll definitely go back to them. I did try getting a dress from another company and I wasn't happy with the results at all!
summary: Make you sure you let them know EXACTLY what you want.

It fit perfectly and looked positively regal. She was showered with compliments on the dress. DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!!!

I have admired the Pandora bracelets for years but they were just not in my price range. I didn't even put them on my wish list for Hubby. But the Pandora style bracelet by Maddie M Designs is just what I've been looking for. I got the starter bracelet. It's not one of those cheap knock-offs that will tarnish and change colors. This one is made of surgical grade stainless steel. So not only is it strong, it is hypo-allergenic and looks good too. It is a snake chain with a lobster clasp, an extender, and a heart charm. The connectors at each end of the snake chain unscrew to allow the Pandora style charms to slip on. At the end of the extender there is a heart charm which, though small, could be engraved with an initial.

There are all kinds of Pandora style charms sold online, in craft stores, jewelry, and discount stores. This bracelet is lightweight but sturdy and well constructed. I would not hesitate to put more expensive charms on it and know they would be secure. Who knows? Maybe I'll hint enough for Hubby to get me a Pandora charm for Christmas. I purchased this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.
summary: A fine substitute for those pricey Pandora bracelets

reviewText:
I am really excited about giving this beautiful Pandora Style Bracelet by Madie M. Designs to my daughter for her birthday.  I then can purchase different charms or beads for her to add to this bracelet.
  The bracelet is very attractive with it snake silver band and a very study clasp on the end for closure.  It is easy to handle and put on and off.  I love the little heart chain that hangs for the clasp.  I am planning on getting the heart engraved with y daughter's initials.
  This bracelet is made of stainless steel making it hypo-allergenic and will cause any irritants against the skin.  It is also well constructed of 316 Stainless Steel and will not rust or corrode. I receive this product at a discount or for free for my honest and unbiased opinion.

reviewText: It's see through. I can't wear it to swim at all

While I wish this was higher quality, I did not expect much so I am very happy with it.  It is super cute and definitely an eye catcher.  With a couple of warnings I would not hesitate to recommend this.  And here they are:

It is unlined thin and see through especially when wet.  I wear with a pair of silicone nipple covers and a nude thong underneath, and problem solved.  It is not ideal, but makes it work.

When I purchased this it just said one size.  The detail page has been updated to say XS to M, and they mean it.  If you are larger this isn't going to work for you.  If you have a long torso it isn't going work.  And most important if you above a B cup you are not going to get much coverage and be prepared to fall out on top (again nipple covers for the save).

Shipping from China takes a while.  I received it about 3 weeks after ordering, so don't expect it in a hurry.

And you can decide if this is good or bad, but every nerd you cross paths with while wearing this is going to fall madly in love with you... just a warning.
summary: Dont expect too much and it great

Looks and feels great! At first I was nervous getting white tungsten because I was worried it would be a cheaper metal. Although I did some research and found out that tungsten is right below a diamond as far as hardness goes, so it'll never lose it's polish. The one draw back I found is that harder metals like this one tend to be more brittle, so it'll break easier. Although Thorsten has such a great warranty that I figure they're pretty confident it'll never break. One other helpful fact that you might want to be aware of is that you can't resize tungsten (because it's so dang hard) so they need to send you a brand new ring when you send it in to get resized. The warranty should cover this, but if you're sentimental then that's a big deal. For me, if it breaks or gets resized I'm just going to have a priest bless the new one. I bought my fiancee a white gold ring and it's already losing it's color. My brother in law has a platinum band and the edges have slowly become rounded. White tungsten looks the same as white gold (as long as it's *white* tungsten) and is a heck of a lot cheaper, and meanwhile will maintain it's color, shape and luster for a lifetime. As long as you get a good warranty (not because you'll use it but because it shows that the manufacturer has confidence in their product) then I say go for tungsten!

I bought this well made, thick  95 % cotton shirt in the Fraise Du Boise colors. I expected alot out of this shirt since ALL the other reviews gave it a 5 star rating and glowing reviews. When I tried it on, it exceeded my high expectations. It slipped easily in place and fitted perfectly on my frame. The thought came into my head that it was sewn and designed just for me. The picture of the model wearing it on the Amazon page really doesn't do it justice.  It is very flattering. It is not a light shirt. I would never wear it anywhere hot and humid. For comfort, I would wear it at the highest temperature range of 67 degree Farenheit. For reference, I am acclimated to a temperate climate in the San Francisco Bay Area. The colors and patterns are wonderful. Bravo to whoever designed this shirt, picked the fabric, and sewed it! If I had to say one word about how it looks on me, it would be "Wow." I am very pleased I decided to get the last one in my size during the summer sale, after being on the fence about it for a couple of weeks. It wasn't much of a discount, but I feel I made a very good purchase.
summary: Very flattering, forgiving, well made shirt

I ordered this dress for my daughter and how I wanted to love this dress. But when I receive this order, I was so disappointed and just wanted to return it immediately - the worst purchase I have ever done online!

1) I ordered the dress in pink color, but the dress I received is not pink, especially the material for the front, looks very very yellowish or brownish, it's like an old dress which had been worn 10 years already. The picture online is totally misleading.
2) And there's no price tag attached on the dress at all, which makes you believe that it is like a piece of old stuff collected from donation.

Amazon shouldn't allow such kind of seller with such poor quality products to sell online.
Save your money don't buy it unless you want to have a life lesson.

reviewText: The silk shirt looked better in the picture for quality.
Im happy with this purchase

As described, a quality silk shirt.  Prior to ordering, I contacted the seller and provided my measurements and asked what size would fit.  I was advised to order the size I regularly wear. I informed "SURPRISEsilk's agent that my dress shirt size is 17 1/2 inch neck, 44 chest and 34-35 sleeves. In casual shirts, depending on the maker, my size is large or x-large. The large size "SUPRISEsilk"shirt I received had a measured neck of 17 1/2 inches, but the chest was too tight, the length is slightly short and the sleeves measure 31 inches.  This shirt would be acceptable for a person with short arms and short torso. The fabric is 100% silk, it is thin and has a nice texture. It looks as illustrated as to pattern, color and it is also well made. I contacted the seller and the "Surprise Silk" representative took my cancellation for two other shirts I ordered yesterday, 8-11-15. Regrettably, as stated, the received order is a nice silk shirt at a great price.  "Surprise Silk" provided fair customer service, but this shirt fit is too small, so I am returning it. A big consideration when purchasing clothing on-line is the inability to touch and check for fit. Disappointed even directly contacting "Surprise Silk" for correct shirt size the size stated was wrong. I hope this info helps other buyers. I'm also advising the seller, that their incorrect guess of fit cost me $7.50 S/H and 11 days of delay.
summary: Nice 100% silk shirt, fair customer service, wrong size.

reviewText:
I am glad to find Silk shirts for men, again...  it is the best all-round dressy, indoor-outdoor shirt (like a flanel shirt).
Silk has a high coefficient of thermal retention. It is like flanel, but without the weight.
I can wear it in the cold, and it still keeps me warm enough.  People say "aren't you freezing?" "Nope - it's Silk"
I tell ladies... get silk blouses... forget the sweater.
I have worn out man of my old ones (10+ yrs), and now I find a website !
These fit a bit tight around the chest (Oriental vs USA bodies).
However these silk shirts are thinner than the ones I got long time ago. They are light also, like these, but the cold comes through on these.
Just a bit too thin.  Still great for indoors.
Would like to see a bigger variety and in XXL  :)
summary: Finally, Silk shirts are available again.  Nice indoor/outdoor warm shirts

2 orders both (L  XL) too small. Put them on a slow boat to China

It's been a very wicked-hot summer here in Texas so I bought a number of these to help me stay cool.

I had to return my original shirts because the size was entirely too small. If you normally wear a "LARGE" please note that you probably will have to return them and reorder an EXTRA LARGE as I did. I think LARGE in China is different than LARGE in the western world.

PROS...
Doesn't hold and trap heat like heavier shirts do.

CONS...
My original silk shirts I bought many years ago at a local store did a great job of allowing moisture to escape my torso but these SURPRISE shirts (despite being much thinner silk material) don't and they are not very good on a humid day.

The sewing doesn't look very durable and one button on one shirt on the sleeve came off after the first day of wearing it, and before ever going into the washer (I always wash my silk shirts by themselves on delicate...)

One thing I'll add that is a "bonus" for me. These shirts have such odd patterns, I can wear them on our ranch here in Texas and I'm basically blending into the background. I like that, because people running scams who try and sell everything from left over asphalt, to "fresh Gulf shrimp" always stop near my gate when they see me working outside but these SURPRISE shirts blend in with the vegetation so well, nobody can see me (or they might simply think "what's that space alien  doing out there in that cow pasture?"
summary: ... bought a number of these to help me stay cool. I had to return my original shirts because ...

reviewText: Pretty good and pretty fast

There are good and bad things about these shoes, however the bad outweighs the good. The measurements you send will be the ones they use. If you give exact measurements they may not fit the best. I made this mistake and they were quite snug. The height that you send is where the boot is going to lay, and if you want them to go above your knee like in the series measure above your knee. Furthermore, I am a cosplayer and try to go to cons several times a year. I got these last year and they worked fine, and it isn't like I wore them constantly. However, as time went on the seams on top of my foot started to rip and I had to re-sew it and then later I had to repeat this on the other boot. The zipper on one of the boots ripped away the boot and I was unable to zip it up at all. I was quite upset with this and I might have to get new boots within a year of having purchased these. I expected these would last longer considering the price. Also, the boots do not have comfort soles so I recommend purchasing them if you don't want your feet to hurt.

These boots are wonderful! They look simply fantastic and the pu-leather feels grand! They are sturdy and well made, and are spot on for cosplay! I know that taking the measurements seems a but tricky but here is what I did:

First, take all your measurements accurately and write them down. I used a measuring rope for this.

Next, I would reduce the calf measurement by one centimeter. I did this and the boots zipped up snuggly and I don't have the huge gap in the back that everyone talks about. And, don't worry, there is still plenty of space to stuff pants into it.

After that, determine whether you want a tight fit around your foot or a looser one. I increased my foot measurements by one centimeter each so that my foot has plenty of room to move around.

And, finally, for the boot height, it includes the top flap, so you definitely want to increase that. I increased mine by about three centimeters and it just comes over my knee l, so if you want it to go completely over it, I would suggest adding on at least another four centimeters, for a total of at least seven centimeters.

Also, you may want to buy some insoles for cushioning, if you want.

Even though you gotta play with the measurements, it is totally worth it. These boots are amazing, and do not smell nearly as bad as what I expected them to, they just smell like new shoes.

So, if you are looking for cosplay boots, look no further, these are the shiz!

The fabric and accompanying belt has a horrid gasoline/petroleum smell. I threw the belt away-cheap plastic and the metal grommets have spread rust stains along the white color where it sat touching-and the dress seems to have lost most of the poisonous odor after I soaked it in warm water and detergent for an hour then rinsed it really well. The front pockets sit well above the bust line and the rear pockets sit well above the buttocks, so basically the whole thing just feels and looks bizarre and ill-fitting. The buttons are loose and jangly. There are loose threads and clumped bits of thread as well as unfinished edges all over the inside of the garment. Basically the only reason I'm not returning it and getting a refund is the extreme hassle involved in sending a package back to China. Now that it doesn't smell like an oil refinery, I'll iron it and find a 12 year old girl with no breasts or rear end on whom it will drape and probably look cute.
I wish I could have ordered 1/2 size smaller. But overall, I like it.
summary: Fengbay womens short sleeve jean skirt

reviewText:
This is a professional-looking bag that works well for men or women. It has plenty of options for storage and two ways to carry. I prefer zippers to the plastic clasps in front, but that's not a dealbreaker and it is a good quality bag for a very good price.

Stitching on the outside of the bag looks very good. There are some unfinished spots on the bottom of the inside-- obviously, no one but you should ever see that, but it does explain one way this differs from more expensive bags.

Unless you're dealing with true snobs, no one is going to look down on a bag like this-- it looks more expensive than it is and seems to be well made. I've already used it on a trip and it held up beautifully. It's a soft material that wipes clean easily (I managed to get honey on mine!), and zippers and clasps worked smoothly.

reviewText: These shoes are gorgeous and totally worth the cost. They aren't like other glittery shoes where the glitter is coming off everywhere. The glitter is part of the sturdy material of the shoe. The heel is thicker so little girls can walk easier in them (especially giving that they are a 2" heel), and the heel appears to be sturdy enough to handle heavier walking little girls. The velcro is very solid, and I have no doubt my daughters could walk in these shoes without them coming undone. The point that gives these shoes a 4 star instead of a 5 star rating is that they run 1-2 sizes too large. My youngest daughter wears a size 9 toddler but in this shoes 9 toddler, I can put a thumb between her heel and the heel of the shoe plus she has another half a thumb length between her toes and the end of the shoe. My other daughter wears a 13 little girls but just moved in to that size, so I ordered a 12 to be cautious. She also has half a thumb length she could grow, so I'm returning and ordering the 11.
summary: Adorable, sturdy shoes that run huge!

When I bought this watch, I was in need of a self-winding skeleton-style watch to replace a different one that had broken after many years of use. From the images, this watch looked like a good fit for my style. Once I got it, though (many weeks later, by the way . . . no Prime shippingwhich itself was an indication of troubles to come), there were a few things that didn't seem right. First, Im not sure what the numbering on the outside of the bevel is supposed to represent, but these numbers don't add any functionality to the watch. Furthermore, the small circle on the left side of the face of the watch is just that: a small circle. Theres no secondary second hand there, and its pretty much meaningless.

As for the functionality of the watch, there have been many questions about if the band can be adjusted. The truth is, it can be adjusted, but youll have to take it to a jeweler to do so. There are no adjustment tools included with this watch for you to be able to adjust the band yourself. Unfortunately, this wasn't even the most significant flaw: the watch didn't keep time at all. Usually, Ive had to purposely move my wrist for the first few days of wearing a self-winding watch, but after a few days, itll accumulate enough charge that it will keep time even if Im not wearing it. After a week, this watch wouldnt keep accurate time overnight, even when I wore it to bed. It would also run out of charge mid-way through my day, which shouldnt happen given the activity that I do that normally keeps this type of watch wound up.

As I was searching for replacement watches, the price of this piece allured me, but after my ordeal in trying to return it, the lower price wasn't worth it. A reliable self-winding watch has historically cost me anywhere from $100 to $150, and for a good reason. Aside from the flaws I mentioned above, I was trying to not buy from a brand that seemed to be obviously Chinese. I figured Carrie Hughes sounded like an American brand, but boy was I wrong. When I got the watch (again, after about two weeks of waiting), it came in a package covered in Chinese characters and containing a card typed up entirely in German that I think was asking me to give them a 5-star review. Once I realized this watch didn't work, I went through the painful process of returning it. This process was constantly hindered by what appeared to be a fundamental lack of understanding of the English language. I had to continually be hounding the seller to provide me with the option to return the item (since it wasn't eligible through Amazons normal process), and then had to follow up with them once the USPS tracking number had shown the package had reached them (of which I had to pay for shipping). They never told me that they had received my return until I asked about it two weeks later, at which point I finally was able to get my refund.

In short, if you want something that kind of looks nice, but doesnt function, this watch is for you. Otherwise, stay away!

reviewText: WOW, I am so happy! This bag was supposed to be at my home on May 28th. I received it today 4/23. That was such a big headache off my shoulders. Because I was do to fly out on the 20th of May. And my bag, That I had gotten several years ago, with age. The zipper was acting funny. Which I used that bag everyday. Including sleeping with it, for 8 days in the hospital. It was time. I couldn't find a bag like this anywere. So by luck, I found it here. The double zippers on top are great! So I am able to put my meds on one side. The other for paperwork. The front pockets I use for my wallet and pens. Then the wonderful card slots. So it easy to just pull out that gas card or ATM cards. The sides for makeup and change. Then the extra pocket that is inside of the 1 big pocket, for my keys. Or For jewelry: If you just want to take something off. So as, not for it to get broken. It is wonderful. If it was in purple. I would have ordered 2. So Please get more purple bags. Otherwise its the best bag, I have gotten in a long time. Good Job! Thank you (I ordered the green bag, Great color)

I LOVED THIS BAG, I LOVE THE COLOR-MY FAVORITE COLOR. IT FIT SO COMFORTABLY AROUND MY SHOULDERS AND EASY ACCESS WHEN YOU'RE IN THE CITY AND ON THE GO. THE POCKETS HAD PLENTY OF ROOM AND THE ZIPPERS WERE VERY EASY.. THE PROBLEM I HAD IS THAT THE STITCHING ON THE STRAP ON EACH END OF THE BAG IN  THE MAIN ZIPPER  AREA RIPPED APART WITHIN 1 MONTH OF USE AND I TRIED TO REPAIR-STITCH IT TO MAKE IT STRONGER, BUT IT JUST UNRAVELED ON ME AND I HAD TO THROW IT AWAY. I SPENT  $39.95 ON THIS BAG THAT I HAD TO TOSS AFTER A MONTH OF USE. I WAS UPSET BECAUSE IF THE STITCHING WAS STRONGER I WOULD'VE USED THIS BAG FOR YEARS. I DID NOT EVEN PUT ALOT OF STUFF IN THE BAG TO WEIGH IT DOWN.., BUT LIKE I SAID THE STITCHING ON THE ENDS OF THE STRAP WAS NO GOOD-NOT STITCHED PROPERLY-NOT STURDY ENOUGH.

This is a great organizer bag.  This bag has so many zippered pockets that it's hard to remember what I put in each one.  This bag seems well sewn and would be great for travel.  The two zippered sections on top open wide and allow you to keep your money separate from all of the other stuff you carry.  This bag is large, but not so big that it looks like you're carrying a piece of luggage.

ONE CAVEAT = this bag comes in two versions.  One has zippered pockets on BOTH ends and the other only has one pocket on one end.  I wanted the bag with pockets on both ends as it looked more balanced and would have even more storage space.  The Big Handbag Shop sent me the other bag with only a single end pocket (which, I feel, looks unbalanced).  Their solution to this problem was a cash discount on the original price --- which is nice --- but I'm still stuck with the wrong bag.

reviewText:
I ordered this because I liked the decal on it but once I received it, I'd have to say that I was very, very happy with the feel of the fabric that was used.  It is nice and soft and yet has the feel of some of the moisture wicking fabric that I have on a few other shirts.  It is very comfortable and falls nicely into the not too hot and not too cold while wearing area (at least it does that for my tastes).

In the end, this was a great purchase for me.  It will serve me well for wearing around on weekends while I have my dog out for a walk through the neighborhood.  The black fabric may get a little toasty on hotter summer days, but should be tolerable enough for me to remain comfortable.  A rare 5 star rating from this reviewer.

I shopped around for a birthstone ring to give my daughter as a gift in the same price range and came up with junk, so I gave this one a shot. The ring came in a super fast fashion. To be honest this is the first time ordering jewelry online and was a bit worried that what I purchased would be the usual " looks better in the picture than in person " scenario, not the case this time. The ring presents itself very well, and much better quality than expected. It definately is a great value for the money, the stone was very nice. The setting I had a concern about so I took it to a jeweler and he stated that the setting was correct, and that with gemstones that aren't as hard as a diamond, the prongs will not be as tight due to the stones' tendency for cracking or chipping. ( Keep this in mind if the stone wiggles a little. As long as it's not excessive you'll be fine) All in all I think a great deal and money well spent. My daughter will enjoy this for years to come.

This whole thing was an experiment for me. In the winter I tend to wear blend socks that are a bit ticker than my regular cotton ones and thru the day they start to go down. I am not talking about super thick wool socks, just regular blend socks. I use pretty much the same dress shoes winter and summer so I cannot wear "sweater thick" socks in the winter. I thought I would give these a try. And here you have "my learnings". It may work differently for some one else.
I am giving it two stars for two main reasons:
Number one, I do not think the product was designed to work with men socks. Maybe it was my fault for not reading some of the reviews, which now, I realize have commented on this issue. The pulls do not work with regular men socks because they are too small; I attempted to use it with 4 different pairs. In addition, most men socks are mid to upper calves and the pulls are still too short to reach that from the right below the knee part. I think these will be great if you are wearing ladies below knee stockings or something that thin (I am sure there is a proper name for them, I just do not know. The are made of stocking material, but they are socks right below the knee.)
Number two, the buckles that close the part that goes around you leg are made of metal. They are super sleek looking; but if you have hairy legs your hairs will be pulled.
I do have to say, the product seems of very good quality, and it is very nice looking; just did not work for me; with my socks, and my hairy legs. I am going to try something called military shirt/socks stays. We shall see how that goes.
summary: Not sure it is really for mens wear.

I was looking for a swim suit top that would increase the look of my small frame. When I went online to research styles that can add to a small bust, I found out that this type of color blocking would work. All of the links, however, lead me to sites with tops in the 100s of dollars. This top definitely emphasizes my top and adds so much support for such a good price!

I have always worn x-small bikini tops, however, when I received my x-small Tropez bikini I found that it was too small.  I wear a small cup in bras, but I was somehow spilling out of this bikini top.  I returned the x-small and reordered a small in fluorescent blue.  This one fits much better, but it is still snug across the front.  The upside to this is that I cannot see this bikini accidentally sliding down/up when rough water is hit.  Unfortunately, that is where the positives stop.  The first time I tried on the small top, it stabbed me.  The boning is already coming out of one of the sides.  This, combined with the high price and the constrictive fit, makes this purchase a flop in my book.  My advice is to buy a different, and cheaper, bikini.

summary: Nice wallet & small enough for front pocket.

reviewText: Thin for the design. The leather seems to be of better quality than I was expecting, though not a premium leather by any means. I love the RFID blocking lining. It is a woven design and not just a foil lining like most competitors. I like that the cash can be folded in half. It was a great purchase for the price, and one of the best options I have found for a wallet with the features I have been looking for.

Nice and thin, but never saw any documentation of its RFID blocking capabilities.  Switched to Identity Stromghold leather billfold, too thick and stiff before I added cards and cash.  Switched to Identity Stonghold nylon card case, limited numbers of cards and cash, and still very thick.  Just bought the Allett Mule Ballistic Nylon version, which documents RFID blocking materials used and frequencies blocked.  Too bad they weren't on Amazon!

I want to make it clear that I love the wallet design.  However, after about 5 months of use, the wallet started smelling.  I had apparently worn through the top layer of the leather and sweat had started to soak into the material when I would walk on hot days.  I suppose this is a fine wallet for dry climates or if you never go for long walks.  I don't think I did put the wallet through anything extreme and I have never had a problem with any past wallets I have owned.  I'm still trying to see if I can salvage it, because I do like the design.
I have over 20 cards, plus miscellaneous papers and money.  This wallet is by far this thinnest I have ever had.
summary: Great wallet.  Thinnest I have ever had

reviewText: Clever way to get rid of that wallet bulge that most men have.

summary: Would recommend to any one looking for a quality built wallet

reviewText: Husband happy with it.

I loved the original and recently bought this as a replacement. Everything I loved about the original is here and the inside material is not noisy like the nylon in the original was until it got broken in. I feel like the stated capacity of "up to 20 cards" is understating things a bit, I can easily fit 8 credit card thickness cards in each of the 4 pockets.

My main complaint is that the description does not mention anywhere that the RFID blocking does not work for all RFID cards. Specifically, it does not block proximity cards commonly used as keys. Nothing on their website that I could find mentions the limitation either. A third party review I found mentions that the cards operate on a lower frequency than what the wallet can block. This should be disclosed on the product description.
summary: Great Wallet, overstated RFID blocking claims

reviewText: Like it but too hard to get cards out of middle

Although this is a nice-looking wallet, the credit card slots were so tight that I had a difficult time trying to insert/remove my credit card(s).

I finally gave up and returned it to Amazon.  I have peripheral neuropathy in my hands and I just don't have the dexterity to fight trying to remove a card (or my license).

I had purchased two of these (the other in the tan ostrich pattern), thinking I'd give one to my daughter for Christmas.  But there's no way I'd burden her with the same problem.  It's really a shame that they didn't allow just 1/16th of an inch more for easy access.

I suppose that with use the slots may loosen up, but no one should have to "break in" a wallet that should have been made properly to begin with!
summary: Credit card slots are WAY TOO TIGHT!

So to begin with, you need a very specific body type to pull this off. It was just not flattering on me, and the boob part was just constantly coming off. I'm not sure if it's just because of how it's cut and that it would act like this on everyone or if it's just because I have no boobs, I'm inclined to think it might act like this on everyone to some extent but if you have more substance in the cleavage department that it might help a little (either way it's nothing some tape shouldn't be able to fix). I'm 5'8, 140lbs, 36b, and usually a medium in tops and a large in leggings (smaller ones are just too short). 5 or 6 in pants, and I think a 29 although I haven't had anything sized that way in years. I bought a large in this and it was the proper size for me, a bit of camel toe effect but minimal and it could be solved with the strategic use of a pantyliner (personally one of my favorite fashion tricks).

Unfortunately I don't have much of anything in the hip department either, maybe if I had either hips or boobs, at least one of the two, this might've looked pretty good, but I don't so it just looked silly. It did improve when I stuck a cute long sleeved hooded crop top on top of it, so there is always that option if you end up getting this and it doesn't flatter you either, and you can also put shorts on top of it along with the crop top to further cover up any unsightly bulges while still having an interesting vaguely out-of-the-box type look if shipping costs make returning it nonsensical.

I gave it four stars because while it didn't look good on me, it DID look like it did in the picture, I just don't have the right body for it, and the fabric feels really nice and silky and has a good amount of stretch to it, and the legs were actually long enough for me which is not the case a lot of the time (also the butt part did look really good, but it just wasn't enough to salvage this for me).

If you have proportions similar to the woman in the picture (or if you at least have nice hips) then get this, along with some fashion tape and pantyliners :) if you don't you might end up disliking this but it can be repurposed to serve as something interesting to wear underneath a different outfit to switch things up.

Good luck :)

UPDATE: Added a couple pictures for reference, I wore a bra under it and then covered that with my hand/phone for modesty purposes but it should give at least a general idea of what it looks like
summary: This can be very unflattering but on the right body it could look great

reviewText:
This dress I purchased in 2016 is true to it's size. I'm 4feet 11and weight 97lbs and my wedding dress is a size 4 from year of 2010. In 2016 I bought this dress from amazon to wear for my cousin's wedding after reading all others comments. I ordered a size 4 and it fits perfectly on my body except the length. The length was too long. First I adjusted the straps (top) by hands to shortened it by 1inch shorter so that the cup of the dress is on my chest. Then I had to cut the dress length shorter because it was too long. I hand sewed the dress length by hand after cutting off the length by about 3 to almost 4inches off the dress bottom (can't remember exact inches but was a good width of fabric and this is an estimate since I threw my discard fabric away and can't measure them anymore).
After stitching by hand my dress to fit on me perfectly with my 2.5inch heels for my cousin's wedding. I had a lot of complements about my dress, hair and makeup and my family asked where I bought my dress because they said it is beautiful and perfect for the wedding in a humid tropical climate near the beachfront. They were surprised to know that it was from amazon and was pretty,beautiful and well made like it came from a department or a bouquet store. The dress was not heavy on me and looked amazing. I will be ordering  other dress from this site in my future for sure when another occasion comes up.  My pictures are from the day I got the dress without any adjustment to fit on me. I even took a photo of it after hanging my dress on plastic hanger without alteration, then I hung my dress on top of my bedroom door to try and show how long it was.
I like to give it 4.5 stars but can't so I gave this dress a rating of 4stars because it was really long for my height even with 2.5 inches heels without alteration on the day I got my dress from the mail.
summary: Beautiful, exact sized as it stated and is long in length.

I can't stress how impressed I am with these corsets!  They are heavy and I'd be surprised to ever see any of the boning poking through the material.  This is the second one I bought (mainly because the first one was too big but I didn't return it because I still liked it).  I'll definitely buy more now that I've figured out my size!

So I absolutely love this corset. It's well made and sturdy, it doesn't hurt or pinch when it's on, and it looks fabulous. The fabric is very nice, as are the clasps, which are really easy to close and which stay closed. It's a little hard to lace up by myself, but that's expected. The only complaint I have is that the bust just doesn't fit right. It's not as though it's really too big, but the upper part of the cup go straight up instead of curving over you bust. It may look better if you have a larger chest, but for me it just feels weird. Luckily a shirt can fit under it and makes it look a whole lot better.
The hips do flare out a bit, but if you plan on wearing a skirt it's nice because there's room for it to go under the corset.
Over all I'm very pleased with the quality and could not ask for a better corset for the price.
summary: Amazing for the price, except one thing...

Nice wallet, holds everything I want it to, and good to know my cards are secure! I purchased the red leather, it is a nice shade of red, not too bright, and the leather is very soft.

The quality of the wallet is mediocre - the metal logo on the front is slightly skewed (not horizontal) and the back of the wallet was scratched already when I got it out of the box. The leather is quite thin and the magnetic lock is quite strong, so the lock threatens to tear the leather around it every time you open the wallet.
At that particular moment I just had my card details stolen - so I was in a hurry to get any RFID blocking wallet before a long international trip and didn't care much about the looks - so I didn't bother to return/exchange it.

Now, a year later, it's still holding up - no more scratches, zippers are working fine and the lock hasn't torn the leather yet (although the leather is already stretched around the lock so I have to be extra careful to open it). But most importantly, it does block my cards.
I also got a passport holder from the same manufacturer and its quality seems to be okay.
summary: Mediocre quality but does the job

reviewText: I've worn this belt for six months. For the most part, it is well designed, comfortable and as adjustable as promised. The one glitch I've found is that occasionally, the release lever gets stuck and requires some fussing to get it to work. I'm hoping that this problem does not worsen over time.
Great

I purchased this belt June 24th 2014. Not a year later and it's useless now. First of all I had to keep re-cutting the belt just so I could refresh the "bite" from the buckle. Every week or so the belt would simply slip out because the teeth inside the buckle wasn't really getting in there, but it did leave gouge marks in the leather each time it came out so I would have to snip. It got to the point where I bought a mitered scissor (for $15) just so I could be certain I was making good square cuts in the leather. Eventually I had to replace the strap (of course) and still I have these problems. Now today, less than a year after purchase, the belt buckle just decided to fall apart into pieces. The pins that held all the moving parts together just fell out and the thing just crumbled like a cracker.

The idea is good but the execution of the Eazybelt leaves a lot to be desired. I've ordered a competing brand because I still want a ratcheting belt. No way am I going on the cheap anymore though.
summary: Spend $10 more and get a good ratcheting belt instead!

reviewText:
First, this belt system exceeds my expectations.

I was initially hesitant because of my doubts about the EazyBelt track system. Now, I realize that my apprehension was ill-founded. It works. More accurately, the ratcheting buckle works. Well, after I figured out how to properly use the release button.

A brief scare occurred when I couldn't get the buckle to release the tension on the belt in a desperate time of need. Whew! Then, after some due diligence... trial and error... I finally learned the trick. Thereafter, all is well and wonderful.

I'll eventually learn about it's durability over time but for now, I'm delighted with the system and the apparent quality of the components.

I can use even the silkiest scarves with no slipping, and the headband feels comfortable and fits securely but not overly tight.

Ordered for my mom and she loves it.

While this does hold my wig securely, it is poorly made and not designed for you average sized wig wearer. My head is a little small at 20.5", however I am able to comfortably wear an average wig. The average wig is designed to fit a 22" head and be able to be pulled in by 1/2-1". This headband is designed to fit a 22"-23" head before it's stretched slightly on your head. If you fasten it any less than 22", the rough part of the Velcro is not secure and can and did grab onto my long wig causing the hair to get caught in the Velcro. In addition to poor design, the material is flimsy and after two uses, it's falling apart. The stitching on the rough side of the Velcro has already begun to come undone,  as has the edge with the serger finish. Between both uses, I haven't even worn it for more than 4 or 5 hours nor have I washed it!  So since I know my way around a sewing machine and need to fix this one and cut to down to fit, I'm using it as a pattern. I purchased material with a similar nap at my local craft store on clearance for $6/ yard and industrial Velcro on sale at $8 a yard. My half a yard of fabric will easily make 8 of these. Considering it will cost about $11 for me to make 8, this is way overpriced for an ill sized and poorly constructed product.
summary: Poorly made with major design flaws

reviewText: I love my new headband. I have lots of hair and it is always difficult to find a headband that is both stylish and keeps my hair in place. Also, a previous headband I had purchased had a stiffer backed hook and loop which seemed to keep my wig more stable and even less ride up on the back of my head.
Overall this is a good product but for me it's just a bit too large.

reviewText: We were so happy to find this outfit because it was the perfect look for two big summer events. I bought two of these outfits for my two and three year old nephews to be matching at their Baptism and later on to wear to my sister's wedding. The outfits are cute and fit the look we were going for, but they are a bit small. I hope they dtill fit by the end if the summer. The boys are slim, but the waist size (even with the elastic) seemed to be a bit tight. The shirts are cheaply made; they're very scratchy material and the button holes started fraying the first time we tried them on. Definitely need a white undershirt underneath!  Although I bought the tan color outfits at the same time, the ties were very different colors. One was more light brown and one was more greenish. On top of that, one of the ties broke imediately. Luckily we had different ties planned. The hats and the shorts themselves are cute and nice. The shorts were a bit see through - careful with colorful underwear or diapers. I didn't notice until it was too late. I'll have to take off and move the buttons on the suspenders since there is no way to adjust them.  One of the boy's suspenders were too short, and the other's were too long. Overall, we were very satisfied with the look of the outfits for the price, but you know, you get what you pay for. Expect to make a few fixes or adjustments. Buy up a size especially if your child has a bit of a tummy.
summary: Cute look, but cheap material, and fits small.

summary: Wallet with ID on the outside good, fat wallet, bad

reviewText: This is well designed and well made. I love this wallet, I love how small and compact it is. I mostly bought it because of the ID placement, but it has amazing storage and organization as well! It holds a lot!

I have a huge wallet I use in my "regular" giant bag, but was looking for a wallet I could use in my Cross Body Bag that I use when my husband and I go riding. I want as little in that bag to keep it as flat as possible because number 1- it hangs around my body so i don't want it to be heavy, and, number 2 - when I ride the Harley, I need my hands free.

I ordered the Dragon Lily Pink wallet as not only do I love Pink, but it looked like a bright wallet in the photo.

I LOVE this wallet!

PROS: BRIGHT Pink Color ~ Makes it easy to see/find.
  2 Zipper Parts  ~ One side has 11 Slots for Credit/Business Cards, The other side for Cash/Receipts etc.
  ID Window  ~ Very easy to put in / take out ID Cards, Easy to see ALL of your ID.
  Craftsmanship  ~ Well made, strong zippers, very good stitching <my pink wallet has pink stitching<, REAL Leather!

CONS: No place good to put any coins.
  You have to fold your paper money to fit it in the wallet.

For me, I don't mind that this won't really hold coins as I have a coin "purse" for that. And I truly don't mind having to fold my paper cash. I am only using this wallet in my cross body bag and we don't get the Harley out but maybe 2-3 times a week, so I only put as much cash as we'll need to eat lunch or dinner.

This wallet is really a nice wallet. If you want something to put your bills n that won't need folding, you need to look at other larger wallets. This is on a 4 inch wallet.

I LOVE that it has so many slot for Credit or business cards. I have 16 cards all together, and some are doubled up - and they fit without any problems at all. No bulging of the zipper and the entire wallet looks great....not over stuffed. It's real leather so I know it will last a long time, provided it's taken good care of!

Buxton makes good products, their quality is exceptional. I know some reviews complain of color combinations, but as long as it does what I want it to, I don't really care what color the stitching is!

I would absolutely recommend this wallet to anyone! It's great! Seller shipped fast so I'm 100% happy with my purchase!

I'm still adjusting to my wallet, I was expecting it to be thinner than it is. I don't have anything new in this wallet that wasn't in my previous wallet that was @ 3/4"-1" wide and this wallet is easily 2"+.  Since I was hoping to be able to slip it into a pants pocket and travel light occassionally, I'm probably going back to my old beaten up wallet.
The wallet itself seems to be well made, just much bigger than I thought.

That is the case, but I've noticed other leather wallets I've had stretch a bit and loosen right up, which I expect to happen with this one. They are not overly tight. I would rather be a little patient than have a too loose pocket with cards falling out.

Personally I love the unusual shape of this wallet, and I don't like to carry a lot of extras so it is perfect for me. If you like to carry a bunch of stuff in your wallet, particularly if you carry a lot of change you might not like it as much.
summary: Great wallet with a unique shape :) Awesome for gifting!

When I got this bag, I could not have been more pleased.  It's the perfect shape, size, & style.  I loved ditching the back problems a purse can cause and enjoyed the ease of becoming hands free. The lining of the black version is a dark teal made of recycled plastic bottles and the outside vegan leather.  All that is great and I would have bought this over and over in every color if not for how it has aged.  It didn't make past 7 months before the straps cracked.  I kept using it because... everything aforementioned. Not long after that, the hardware turned brassy. I guess that part is to be expected but it bummed me out because of the price of the bag. My boss liked my bag so much that she got the larger one marketed for men because she's tall. THAT one has different straps.  They are much MUCH better.  I'm considering writing the company. I'd put up with ageing hardware if I could have better straps. Now, there is still cracking that can occur with vegan leather and there is one crack on the body of my bag, but that's the sacrifice you make when you don't buy a bag made of real leather. Now I'm looking for a new bag from another company and I'm checking out real leather options as an investment.  I wish I didn't feel this way.  It could have been a perfect relationship.
summary: Perfect shape and size. IT DOES NOT AGE WELL.

reviewText: I bought this bag to use as a diaper backpack for my toddler. I was considering a Fawn brand bag but decided against it since it was out of stock. I've been using this bag for a couple weeks now. The quality and design of the bag is really great. I was a bit worried that the vegan leather would look cheap but I was pleasantly surprised by the nice material. The front and side pockets are a bit small and it's hard to fit more than a pair of sunglasses and keys in them if the pack is full. I was able to fit a skip hop changing station (with travel size wipes and four diapers inside), and a full set of sugarbooger organizers including change of clothes, bib, lightweight blankie, two food squeeze packs and small toys, plus one book and a small mam sippy cup inside. There is a cell phone pocket but it is more convenient for me to use a larger wallet that fits the phone inside. I wish the bag were just a little bigger but the way it unzips up top makes it super convenient. It's way more comfortable and attractive than my old skip hop duo diaper bag that had the room necessary for a newborn's things.
summary: Great for a chic little toddler diaper bag!

I've been using it for the past school year and the "leather" has not peeled and there is no pilling on the webbing at the end of the straps as mentioned by a previous reviewer.
However, I did just buy the Vignelli bag in Macaroon which is in the same Dwell (pebbled "leather") finish that that commenter's bag is in. Now I'm worried I'll have the same peeling issues. Leaning towards keeping it because the colour is so pretty. I hope none of my clothes transfer colour onto it.

Sizing/Fit:
Motorcycle helmet manufacturers base their design on one of three head shapes: long oval, intermediate oval, and round oval. The Bell Bullitt TT fits best on intermediate oval heads (most people). That said, I had to go a size up because my head shape is more of a round oval. For reference, I wear a size Small HJC CL-17, size Medium Shoei RF-1200, and a size Medium Bell Bullitt TT.

Style:
I love this helmet because of its retro look. The interior lining is soft and extremely comfortable. There are nice details like the leather visor pull, the shield pod that secures the visor, the chrome trim, and the round red graphic. I also think the cream color give it a classic look. If you search online, there is a video of how this helmet came to be. In a nutshell, a college student created this helmet design as his thesis project and Bell contacted him about producing it.

On the motorcycle:
The helmet provides great air flow. It does not have a chin curtain, so it gets loud on longer, greater speed trips. I use this helmet primarily for commuting, but even then, I wear ear plugs. The helmet provides a wide view range, which I like.

I purchased this helmet from Edwards Motorsports & RV through Amazon. It arrived quickly thanks to Amazon Prime and the helmet was OEM and spankin' new (I've had issues with some sellers on Amazon). I'm happy with this purchase!

summary: My favorite of the SAXX brand

reviewText:
I cannot speak well enough of the comfort of the rocker sole and the insole. There is great arch support, and the sole does not bend.  This is super-important for the who have foot fatigue or plantar fascitis.  Also the insoles are just squishy enough to make your feet feel good, without being so squishy that they hazard quick breakdown.  The insoles are suede.
I may have to send the ones I purchased back because of the fit of the upper.  They are definitely the right size heel-to-toe, but the upper seems to be designed for someone with decidedly thin feet.  If your feet swell, or if you have thick feet, either try a size up or choose a different shoe. There is no way I can fit my feet in there with socks other than nylons.  They are also not nearly as wide as they appear I pictures.  I expected Birkenstock-type roominess, and that is not the case.  The pictures on the site seem deceptive in that regard.  There is less room in this toe box than in the clogs I bought for fashion in high school.  I am trying to work up a little room with some shoe stretchers I have, and they seem to have some give, so I am hopeful.  I will buy Alegria again, but I will be sticking to the sandal styles With adjustable uppers.
summary: Super soles, but not roomy at all!

Just the right amount of bling ~ 11 square shaped jewels in blue, green and turquoise that sparkle when they pick up the light ~ separated by both gold & silver links.  They go with everything.  They have an almost two inch heel ~ not too high and not too flat.  With the rubber sole, you can wear them around the pool or in the rain and not have to worry.  I'm so glad I discovered this company as I believe I will order more shoes in the future from sandals.com with confidence.  I'm glad to order through Amazon, too ~ they arrived fast.  Oh, and did I say they were comfortable, too?  Highly recommend!

reviewText:
Attention nurses who don't own any printed scrub tops because they fit you like a tent-- this is the most flattering scrub top I have ever owned! This style really does fit like the picture of the model shown.
I purchased an XXS and it fits beautifully!  (5'3" / 110lb / 34C). The cut/ style of scrub top is closer to NORMAL sized clothing, unlike most other scrub brands. Those who are small understand the struggle. If you typically wear any layer besides a bra (i.e. a camisole or undershirt) beneath your scrubs, you may want to consider sizing up. With that being said, this top washes well, dries quickly, & doesn't require ironing. (winner!)  The print is super fun and the length of this top is just perfect for a smaller frame. Pair with whatever brand of pants fit you best; I promise the fabric won't look weird.
For a size reference, I usually purchase an XS in the mock wrap style top from Grey's Anatomy. Unfortunately with that style, I find that there isn't enough "boob" room for my taste, but it fits well otherwise. I am happy to say I haven't faced that problem with this top. I will continue to purchase this style in the other available prints. Keep em' coming Jockey!!
summary: this top is perfect for SMALL / PETITE nurses.

I LOOOOOVED these hospital gowns! I had a scheduled C-section for my second child so I bought a second gown (Ella) for my 4-day stay at the hospital. First off, the snaps in the back and front are the best features of this hospital gown. I was able to walk around the maternity floor without feeling that "draft" or fearing that my butt is hanging out. I also didn't need that extra gown to wear around my back to cover up. The front snaps were great for skin-to-skin and nursing as well. The "nursing gown" they gave me at the hospital had open slots in the front so it felt like my boobs were going to pop out at any time unless I was wearing a nursing bra underneath. The snaps on this gown was super convenient for nursing and pumping. This was also very easy to get in and out of whenever I showered or if I had to go to the bathroom. I don't have to look for the laces to tie these around or loosen them if I have to nurse my baby.

I also received compliments from our nurses and even they said "why can't they make hospital gowns with snaps in the back?" ...at least for the maternity floor. Yes...why not? The material was pretty stiff when it arrived so I remedied that by washing these in warm water and put a dash of fabric softener and it was good to go! It had that "worn" feeling to it.  My only "regret" is that I wished I had known about these when I had my first baby. Sure, it's a little pricey but I would recommend this to friends and family!

I was looking for a place to make a custom t-shirt for me and stumbled upon this on Amazon, so I ordered one. Upon receiving this shirt, the packaging was a little damaged, but that was probably just USPS and not the seller. After opening the packaging and going over the shirt I was impressed, it didn't feel like cheap material, the fit was pretty much spot on, and even though the logo was ironed on it still feels like it will last. I recommend washing the shirt immediately after you get it (I usually do this with all my clothes, not just this shirt in particular)

UPDATE: it has been quite a while from when I purchased this shirt to now when I'm writing this review. As expected after wearing this shirt a lot,m and the constant washing the logo has faded a little, and surprisingly the color has also faded quite a bit, but overall I am very happy with my purchase. I recommend anyone looking for anything custom made to buy from CafePress because it seems to hold up for a decently long time and that's hard to find nowadays.

reviewText: This was the 3rd time I bought this shirt for myself (in varying colors).  I've also bought 2 for my Dad.  The material is extremely well made, durable and comfortable.  It's not cheaply woven, and I've never had a seam come loose.  The sizes fit exactly as I'd expect them to.  It takes about 2 years of continuous wearing (2+ times a week est) and washing before you notice any fading.  If you wear it less, the colors last much longer obviously. The colors are amazing; all very rich and well dyed.  The pattern has always been 100% centered.  The best thing about this shirt, for me, is the people I meet when I wear it.  People come up to me and say, "I love my pit bull too!" and I end up making new friends.  I also find the price very reasonable, especially for such a well made product.  I would recommend CafePress shirts.
summary: durable and comfortable. It's not cheaply woven

Fantastic hat. Period. I've looked around a LOT for a BIG airy hat with good sun protection - found it.
Excellent firmness to the wide brim with cloth underside to shade the face and neck. Same cloth on the top (for the slightly balding). Very light, and because it's actually slightly too large (on my big head, 61cm+, 24"+, which is wonderful, allowing it to breathe) I made a few adjustments.
Removed the sweatband (just WAY too hot), added chin straps (shoelace stitched on the inside, see photo), and a loop for clipping to belt buckle, and then decided to ADD the sweatband again (turned out to be a bit too loose without it), but this time also stitched the upper part of it inside the hat, so it doesn't actually touch the head/forehead very much (not like the original "sock around your head" feel).
On a windy day you really want that chin strap (or sweatband if that's for you) since this hat wants to FLY. And on a rainy day you better keep this thing safe somewhere.
The brim can be reshaped (metal wire on the inside) to a style you like. The flat top is something you get used to (would have preferred a slightly more angled shape to it but heck, it works). It's the perfect summer hat for people with big heads (61cm+, 24"+), it breathes, is cheap, and with a few minor adjustment - the best hat I've ever bought. Finally. :D (Let's hope it lasts, will take really good care of it)
summary: Perfect summer hat for BIG heads

The brim provides a good deal of eye shade from all angles, and the neck flap prevents blistering sunburns.  Highly recommended for anyone who likes a versatile, Aussie style hat for hot, sunny climates.

Very nice quality faux fur bolero for girls.  My 7 year old daughter wore this over her flower girl dress to my brother in-law's wedding.  Sometimes faux fur can look very cheap but this cover cup was really nice.  She will also be able to wear it with her Christmas dress if she is cold.  I would suggest ordering up 1 size.  My daughter is very tall & thin and the 8 was too short in the sleeves.  I ordered an 8 but had to return for the next size.

It's quite pricey for what you get but I'm not rating it on that basis. You know how special occasions can be - for the perfect item your budget has a little give - so I'm not rating it based on the price. But I do think it's wrong for a special occasion.

I think it's a costume piece. The white is bright bleach white and the material is so obviously not fur. Why even call it faux fur when it's like a soft carpet? I also don't like the cheap ribbon in the center. Why pay for a gorgeous dress and accessories and then have a cheap ribbon front and center in your outfit?

I ended up trying boleros, shrugs, capelets, wraps, and jackets for the snowy wedding. My favorite was a convincing faux fur stole that added to the beauty of the outfit instead of just looking like a utilitarian or costume piece slapped on top.

Watch out for tops that detract from the outfit and shift focus to the shoulders when you're trying to show the girl. I remember in modeling class, we were taught that you make some clothes look better but some make you look better, so go for the latter. (As a model you have to do the former.)

LOVE. Bought it in 2X. I wear 2X tops and 18 pants. It fits well under the arms and through the torso, and drapes nicely down the back, comfortably loose, but not in the least sloppy. Stylish. Flattering. Does not show any of the figure imperfections.  Royal Blue is gorgeous and Turtle print is VERY pretty. The print is very slimming because the designs are vertically oriented, which helps fool the eye and distract from the mid-section. I'm 5 feet 5 inches, and the length is great on me (a little over an inch below the knee ). The shoulders fit perfectly and the V-neck is great if you use a shoulder-strap purse...no neck stretching.

One thing I like about this dress is that I can use it for vacations in Hawaii, but I will also feel comfortable wearing it here at home. This dress is very versatile. It just "works" for so many purposes. The sleeves, neckline, and knit material of this dress also give a little protection from a chill if there is air-conditioning in the store or restaurant.

Washed it on gentle cycle, cold, with woolite dark, and damp-dried on lowest heat for less than five minutes. It did great. It's completely wrinkle-free. I'm air-drying it the rest of the way on one of those thick foam bendable hangers that don't leave any creases. Does not seem to have shrunk at all. I know the directions say ideally to lay flat to dry but who has the room or special drying racks to do that?  I definitely will buy more of these.

This was one out of about 10-15 gothic victorian-looking pieces I ordered from Yazilind, and overall, I'm very happy with all of them. I'll be honest that I was worried with a larger order of so many small items that the seller might forget one or two items when shipping, but they were all there when I got the parcel. Some of them do need a smidge of DIY TLC. Have some superglue ready in case of pieces falling off (trust me, pieces will never fall off again). Really, though, even with a little assembly needed for SOME of Yazilind's products (only 3 out of the 10-15 I ordered even needed any altering), you're getting some very nice jewelry for the price! I get compliments on my bracelets, necklaces, and wrist cuffs all the time! It's my little secret that they were less than $5 each! The only part of the pieces I received I didn't like was that the bracelets are lobster clamps - so hard to get on by yourself! I feel like pull ties would be much more manageable, and probably look better, too. I will probably find some threads for them and replace the metal chains on the bracelets with pulls instead when I get the chance. Other than those few small complaints, all the items I received from Yazilind were as pictured, comfortable, and very charming. I'd definitely suggest this item as well as other similar pieces in Yazilind's collection.

reviewText: Delivery time was about right for the distance traveled and I believe the wait was worth it. The watch is easy to read and nice to look at. The wrist band is a little bit of issue with my big hands and wrist but once I practiced was able to function with the bracelet style buckling system.

It's a 40 buck automatic, you get what you pay for. Clasp was broken upon arrival (seems to be a common thread with watches sent from this seller judging by other reviews) but I have extras, so I was able to fix that -- but since it was a gift, not a good first impression to have to immediately repair something after giving it to someone.

The fit and finish is mediocre at very best and it doesn't keep very good time but again, what did anybody expect for the price and the cheap auto movement? If you want a decent automatic to get you started on your watch collection I would probably be looking towards Seiko in the $100-200 range, but if you just want something a little larger on the wrist that looks okay from a distance and tells time reasonably well, you could spend the ~$40 in worse ways. Overall, I would not recommend buying this watch and would suggest that you save another $50-100 for a better quality movement and watch overall.
summary: You get what you pay for...

reviewText: Loved the look and feel of the watch. A couple of issues which led to it being returned. One, the watch stopped when you took it off, so you had to set it each morning. My tabi fit very well with just a bit of wiggle room. I bought the women's 6.5~7 US shoe size (24cm length). My feet are 8.7" (22cm) long from big toe to heel, and the widest part of my feet measures 3.5" (9cm). My ankle is 8 3/4" (22.2cm) around.

If your foot measurements are close to mine, or just a tiny bit bigger, then the 6.5~7 size should fit you very well. If your ankle is any bigger around then you might have some trouble fastening the clasps. Mine are snug around the ankles but comfortable. The tabi don't slide around on my feet and they are easy to walk in. They feel even better in a pair of sandals.

These tabi are the real deal, non-stretch, and as far as I can tell from the packaging, legitimately made in Japan (not 100% sure though -- almost certainly imported from Japan at least). The packaging says they are 35% cotton, 65% polyester. I bought these to wear with waraji sandals (Bleach costume, you guessed it) for an upcoming convention. I'm sure I will be able to walk around comfortably for several days in them. I will update this review once I've had a chance to wear them for a while.

My only disclaimers: Before you take them out of the bag, hold the soles up to your feet to see if they match. The seller's note says they are non returnable if they are worn. Also, if you are looking for form-fitting tabi, you will almost definitely not want to get these, as they do not have elastic.

Overall, these fit very well, and I really enjoy them. The quality is good too. They look like they will hold up to some wear and tear. Not bad for my first pair of tabi!
summary: I love them. Compare my measurements to yours!

reviewText:
This is very small, I guess it's expected to be otherwise it wouldn't be able to train your waist. I  had originally bought this for a renassiance fair and it went perfectly with my pirate costume, but then when i started reading the reviews about waist training and how it could give you a smaller waist i decided to give it a try.
Ive used it for about 4 hours a day for 1 week and wow i can already see results. I don't expect it to be permanent but thats ok because im just trying to make my waist smaller for 1 occasion. Its not making me lose weight or anything, it's just making me look like im curvy. Love it. I plan to just use it a week or 2 when i want to look good on a dress or something.
Love how this is made. Quality

Keep in mind, I paid about 25$ shipped, and I have a 27" natural waist line. I am also familiar with waist training, so fully expected this to JUST close over the modesty panel. Over time, the boning and I will get comfy with each other, and I am aiming at about half the modesty panel closing. Unless my trainer at the gym keeps working me, and I add too much muscle and need one size up. LOL.
One worth 100 or more should have a solid tape at the center of the corset to prevent stretching, and a full lining, this has neither. The boning is metal. It is low quality spiral steel. If I like it enough, I will just replace all the boning for about 15$ at a corset supply place. No big deal. Can't replace the busk easily, but that's ok.
summary: Happy camper. Not highest quality, but awesome for price point.

reviewText: For all you guys who are trying to waist train and are looking through reviews,ratings,and details to make sure this is the right corset to buy , I highly recommend you to buy this! I checked if this corset is steel bonded and it is surprisingly! It took awhile to wait for shipping  but it it's worth waiting for definitely !

No stretch and the corset cannot be slackened if it's too small... However once it's on it provides superb back support and promotes good posture while smoothing out any bulges. Can be worn under clothes also... I gave 3 stars simply because of the fact that the purpose of the corset wasn't provided and that should be the component of adjustment. It can be tightened but not loosened
No complaints
