reviewText: Great and comfortable
I am 5'4, 148lbs.. I normally wear a size M in shirts. I ordered the XL and I'm happy with it; I was not looking for a tight fitted look.

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and craftsmanship that appears to have gone into these belts. For the price of 5 bucks, I definitely was expecting a transparent string wearable only by microscope. But this blew all my expectations out of the water.

This is a belt that is true to size, true to picture, all down to the tiniest rhinestone. I ordered the white belt and it arrived quickly from NY in secure packaging. There were no defects (usually with anything involving rhinestones I basically assume a few would have fallen out, but not this!), and the loops aligned with the belt notches and holes. The size was quite hefty  medium-to-large thickness, making this a beautiful statement belt to cinch a tunic or dress. Length was good too, even though I ordered a S/M, this could easily adjust from small to large sizes especially as these work best around the waistline versus hips. I am less sure if this belt with its width would be able to go through pant loops, but for my intents and purposes it really jazzed up my plain dresses.

The customer service was attentive as well, with a cute thank you note in the packaging and contact information at my disposal. The design was impeccable and pretty intricate for the price. It really looks much more expensive than it was, and I have bought my share of designer belts that looked like they should have been sold at this belts price! Even though I got this at a minor discount, I would not hesitate to buy one at retail price. In fact, I think I may be buying their other colors and designs so I can have a spectrum of accessories to match my outfits. Keep a watchful eye for this brand, because if the other designs are as cute as the one I got, this brand has got some potential.

Disclosure: I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review. Particularly, I'm known for either rave reviews, or brutal reviews because I don't lose any incentive to do so - what I say reflects how I actually feel about a product, and honesty comes first. Speaking of honesty, when it comes to reviews, I honestly don't think mine are the very best that no one ever was. I consider my hobby accomplished if my opinions are sorta heard and of course, I am happy if they end up helping any prospective buyers. If not, Ill be fine after crying myself to sleep for a few nights. Its cool.
summary: This brand is so hot right now.

2. The dress hits me at mid-calf. I prefer my maxi dresses to be much longer (preferably at the ankle)

I ordered this suit on a wing and a prayer for a Zoolander costume, going mainly on the size chart, as the price was right (under $80 at the time). As I am female and went by the chest measurement, the fit wasn't perfect and I had to alter it somewhat, but I would expect it to be a pretty average male fit. For what I paid I was expecting something so-so nice, but I was actually very pleasantly surprised by the quality. The suit looks nice and the lining and construction on the interior was especially nice and it has a number of pockets on the inside. The cuffs have 4 decorative buttons.

Be aware that as it is shiny and the picture likely being taken in bright light, it is actually a little darker than it appears in the picture. The pants are not hemmed, so they will have to be hemmed but that means you can then choose with or without cuffs. If you can sew it is no big deal, or a tailor should be able to do it pretty cheaply, but I would expect this with an off the rack suit to be honest.

I bought the red/white striped and the black/white striped onesies. My little guy has a very wide chest, and the torso section of these onesies are very generous, so these are good for big babies (but maybe not skinny little babies). Yes the snaps are different than most US onesies, so its a little bit of a learning curve but not terrible.

My problem was that I ignored the one review here about how the black color on the black/white onesie seemed to "bleed". Mine did not bleed after washing it once, but my son fell asleep in it and when he woke up his face and mouth were covered in black fuzzies, some of which were very clumpy and large! I had to fish black fuzzies out of his mouth. I threw this onesie out because I was freaked out that he has swallowed some of them.

The red/white onesie also did not bleed in the wash, and it looks just like the onesie that the baby wears in the movie Labyrinth, so I planned on putting my son in it for Christmas photos. After several washes, I am constantly finding large clumps and balls of red fuzz all over the place - in his crib, pack n play, changing table, inside his diaper! This did not wind up all over his mouth like the black onesie, but I will not use this for daily wear anymore.

So in short, if you have a big wide baby and want a cute striped onesie without an applique on it for a photo op, these are fine. Just watch out for fuzzies!!!
summary: Pills ALOT, Fuzz everywhere! But good for wide baby

reviewText: Wife loved it
I'm absolutely in love with this bag!!!  The only downside is the inner pocket sometimes makes it hard to just slip things back into the bag when it's worn as a cross body, but I got over it!

I'm a crossbody girl. I like small handbags that carry my basics like phone, small wallet, a pen, Chapstick, and a small planner. I'm in nursing school and work part time at a hospital and education center. I found myself wanting to carry a few more things like hand lotion, a bottle of water, a spiral for various note taking, an epi pen, and snacks. I don't use this as a school bag- just everyday errands. The little small pouch that comes with this bag makes it easy for me to transition from my smaller bag to a considerably larger purse. If I want to leave this bag in the car and just take my wallet and/or cash and phone, I can put them in the pouch and unhook it from the bag and make it a simple wristlet for a quick run into the store. It takes some getting used to wearing crossbody, but wearing it under my arm on my shoulder is very comfortable. It's a great bag I would recommend to anyone. It has plenty of pockets and organization on the inside. I will add photos later if anyone would like to see.
summary: Going to be hard to beat :)"

reviewText: Excellent bag, very roomy with many pockets and places to organize everything! I absolutely love this bag, and bought two of them in different colors, and am very glad I did. Would highly recommend. The zippers on the bag seem fine and I haven't had any problems with them yet. The bag seems to be very well made and sturdy, it should last a long time.

Baggallini is the only kind of purse I carry anymore.  This one is very roomy and I am able to carry a tablet with it nicely secured inside the bag.  Side zip for cell phone is too small for my Android, but the front pocket with a magnetic snap is perfect for my phone.  Easy to get to.

I've been eyeing this suit for a while b/c it looks super comfortable and loose and I like the design, but I wasn't too happy about flashing everybody my goods from the side or even the front should a strong gust of wind appear or a big wave come by. But problem solved! By putting a tube or bandeau top underneath it, I was able to successfully prevent unwanted exposure, and it actually looked like part of the suit! I had to do a tremendous amount of searching through Amazon just to find the right bikini top to wear underneath it (can't have straps, can't be tie in the back, not too much coverage around the chest, etc.) and I found 2 that I really liked and go well with the suit: The Sheridyn Swim and the BC Bandeau tube top.  I especially like the Sheridyn Swim b/c it has a clasp in the back and the bandeau is just a tube you slip on and off. But it was fun b/c I got the bikini tops in a bright and fun color to wear underneath this black suit to give it a little pop of color.

The suit itself isn't really of great material, it's thin and kinda flimsy, but it's not terrible, and it's very inexpensive, so you can't expect too much from it. It's very comfy and you can adjust the straps that tie around your neck like a halter to either have the V Neck drop down and be loose or tighten the straps to make the V Neck flush against your skin. The smaller set of ties go around the front of the suit around the waist to create a tie or bow (that took me a while to figure out). But I like how the suit is breezy and feels like you're not wearing much, especially on top and even with the bandeau or tube top. It's stylish and sexy and daring. The only drawback, is that in the back, where the briefs come up, the banding is slightly tight (especially for a large) so it create a slight bulge, but not bad. For reference, I'm 5'3, 123 lbs and 36C. I got the large and it fit pretty well, other than the slight lower back fat problem.
summary: Put a tube or bandeau top underneath this suit and it's super sexy. I put my recs for the tops in my review

I'm not suggesting that they are not a good short for the right person/purpose, but I would not buy them over again.

reviewText: Can't speak to the durability yet, but these have the longest inseam of all the low end/inexpensive, cool, and breathable mesh shorts I've found.  I sweat profusely in hot weather, but I need the upper leg and knee coverage for off-trail running.  These are the best I've found.  Only two downsides:  1) For sweat control, I would prefer a built in wicking liner, and 2) the mesh snags easily on thorns, shrubbery.  But at this price, you can replace them every couple years and still come out ahead.
summary: Cool, breathable, long and cheap.  That's a hard combo to find.

Again, concept clothing here. The fabric is good though. The fit is rather narrow at the shoulders for an XXL; however, I expected this after reading the reviews & my awareness of the China vendors when it come to their clothing presented thru this type of venue. I really wanted the one released by Adrianne Papell, & in the color Red, but by the time I'd noticed that particular quality brand, it had already sold out in my size, every where!  I'm keeping an eye though for re-stock.
So yes, everyone is right.  This fits super small and bigger chested women would be able to fit it.  I'm an American size 8/10 and bought an XXL and it looks super cute!

The XXL is approx a size 8 in US women's (possibly a 6 depending). Measurements are 34" bust & waist (17 inches across lying flat), and 36" hips (18 inches across lying flat). Length of dress is 31" and the cape is approx 6 inches longer than the dress. I guess I didn't notice that before I ordered.

I am giving this 3 stars because I too find that the sizing is off. It's just not doable for average US women. I understand as a nation we are larger than most Asian people but if you are manufacturing clothing to sell abroad, adjust your sizing. Otherwise for me this dress would be a 5 star dress.

The material is of very good quality (surprising considering the price) and the dress is fully lined! The cape is heavy enough that it is not see-thru. A wonderful dress for a skinny person.

Sadly, I will be returning it. Fit great except tight in the bust for me (I wear 34D) and also the cape does not cover your arms for the most part up top like I thought it would. I think that's why in the photo they have strategically placed the models hair right where you would see that it doesn't connect well to the dress. Also, the shoulders are quite narrow. I am 5' 2" with normal to narrow (US) shoulders and they barely fit mine. If you are broad shouldered forget about this dress.

I'm really disappointed it didn't work out because it really is a wonderful dress...for the right body type :/

reviewText:
I just ordered this dress. Thinking if i read the reviews on this dress for sizes, that I would get some knowledge on how the size ran.
Of course, it takes several weeks to get to me. (I didn't know it came from China) The dress arrives at least a month later. (Thank God I didn't have a important event to attend to.) At first look, I check the package to see where it came from. Of course for this price, the package said it came from China. When I initially ordered the dress. I tried searching the place of orgin. I didn't specify. unless I missed that part. I unwrap the package to find that the dress is looking a little small for an XL. I then proceed to try it on. And of course its too damn small for my frame. Now I'm an US true size 12. I don't look like a size 12US. I get that I look like a size 8. I know my true size.  This dress I ordered in a so called XL is at least a size 8 in China sizes.  I wanted to order it a little bigger to be sure it fits me. Ok, China.. if your going to be in the game to selling to the US as well as copying the US of A. Please!! Please!!... get your sizes right. This damn dress is way too small. At least 3 - 4 sizes in USA size too small. I knew better ordering this dress due to the price ($27.00). However, I'm soo pissed!! I cant send the damn dress back. Just because it will cost me more to send it back than what the dress cost me.  (Thats what the overseas like this pray on) Please china vendors of amazon.com... Get your sizes right for the UNITED STATES. I understand that our sizes here of most people are beyond the recommended height. However, I'm an healthy, California resident from New York City the capital of Fashion. I know sizes. This "ish" is rediculous!! Come on! if your going to copy most of our US designs and everything else that we do.. at least get the sizes, correct!  and if your a United States customer.. Please don't order this dress. Its cute, but it probably won't it over your pinky finger.  If you choose to, please order 4-5 sizes bigger than your true size. Copy that!!! UGH!!!

XL is not an XL its really a US size 6

Frustrated United States customer size 12
summary: UGH!!! I'm pissed...XL is still too small. Are you kidding me?!
